definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: He told me that under each cross is buried treasure.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我每一個交叉點處都有埋藏的寶藏。

sentences.english: The coordinates x, y, and z are called the relative coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 座標軸的交叉點，所有相應值都爲零。

sentences.english: The cross-over point is about 15 times annual rent, the company believes.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司以爲，年租金的15倍左右是一個交叉點。

sentences.english: The pieces are placed and moved on the crossing points.
sentences.chinese: 棋子在交叉點上落子或移動。

sentences.english: The cross-over point is about 15 times annual rent, the company believes.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司認爲，年租金的15倍左右是一個交叉點。

sentences.english: Matrix switch cards generally have two or three poles per crosspoint.
sentences.chinese: 矩陣開關卡通常在每個交叉點有兩個或三個電極。

sentences.english: A cogwheel is placed where the wheat and rice stems cross at the base.
sentences.chinese: 齒輪安在下方麥稻杆的交叉點上。

sentences.english: VCMR is the crosspoint of the differential input signal.
sentences.chinese: VCMR是差分輸入信號的交叉點。

sentences.english: What you see is an intersection.
sentences.chinese: 你看到的是一個交叉點。

sentences.english: The traffic jam happened at a highway junction.
sentences.chinese: 交通阻塞發生在一個高速公路的交叉點處。

definition: the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
